description: Administrative fine for essential entity infringement of Article 21 (cybersecurity risk-management measures) or Article 23 (reporting obligations)
column11: 000 OR (b) 2% of total worldwide annual turnover in preceding financial year whichever is higher
column12: Non-compliance with Article 21 Failure to report under Article 23 Repeated violations Failure to notify/remedy significant incidents Failure to remedy deficiencies following binding instructions Obstruction of audits Providing false/grossly inaccurate information

description: Administrative fine for important entity infringement of Article 21 (cybersecurity risk-management measures) or Article 23 (reporting obligations)
column11: 000 OR (b) 1.4% of total worldwide annual turnover in preceding financial year whichever is higher
column12: Non-compliance with Article 21 Failure to report under Article 23 Repeated violations Failure to notify/remedy significant incidents Failure to remedy deficiencies following binding instructions Obstruction of audits Providing false/grossly inaccurate information

legal_basis_formula: Competent authority issues warning about infringement of NIS 2 Directive
column11: Initial or minor infringements First-time violations

legal_basis_formula: Competent authority orders entity to remedy deficiencies or infringement within specified manner and timeframe
column11: Identified deficiencies Non-compliance requiring corrective action Incident prevention/remediation

legal_basis_formula: Competent authority orders entity to cease conduct that infringes NIS 2 and desist from repeating
Competent authority orders entity to ensure cybersecurity measures comply with Article 21 or fulfill reporting obligations per Article 23 in specified manner/period
Competent authority orders entity to inform service recipients of significant cyber threat and protective/remedial measures
column11: Significant cyber threat affecting customers Customer notification failure

legal_basis_formula: Competent authority orders entity to implement security audit recommendations within reasonable deadline

penalty_type: Order to Make Public Aspects of Infringement
legal_basis_formula: Competent authority orders entity to publicly disclose aspects of NIS 2 infringement in specified manner

description: Competent authority designates monitoring officer with defined tasks for determined period to oversee entity compliance with Articles 21/23
triggers: Serious/repeated non-compliance Need for ongoing compliance oversight

description: Competent authority (or certification/authorization body/court) temporarily suspends certification or authorization concerning part/all of entity's services/activities until deficiencies remedied. Last resort measure.
triggers: Ineffective enforcement measures after deadline Serious/persistent non-compliance endangering service security

description: Competent authority requests courts/tribunals to temporarily prohibit natural person with managerial responsibilities (CEO/legal representative level) from exercising functions until deficiencies remedied. Last resort measure.
triggers: Ineffective enforcement measures after deadline Management failure to ensure compliance Serious/persistent non-compliance

description: Natural persons responsible for ensuring entity compliance can be held liable for breach of duties under Article 20 (management oversight obligations)
triggers: Management body failure to approve/oversee cybersecurity measures Breach of duty to ensure compliance
